page.title: 10TRANSPORT IN EAST SWINDON
page.content:
We have got three kinds of transport in our square. {RAILWAY} The piece of{Railway}in our square is part of the G.W.R.'s route to LONDON. It goes from BRISTOL to LONDON and the number of trains that pass through our square Monday's to Friday's is 19.On Saturday's it is 36. {THE MAIN ROAD The main road leads off from the magic roundabout it has LONDON to the east and OXFORD to the north.
{OLD CANAL The Old Canal lead's up towards the works.It used to be called the{Wilts & {Berks}canal,and now it has been turned into public walking path.In the 18th century they used to go down the canal in barges with coal for people in the railway village.
